column1: #Text=A “ facilitator ” is someone who acts as a ' lubricant ' by helping a team with issues such as communications or problem solving but , typically , does not contribute to the actual content or management of a team 's project ( which is a team leader 's function ) .
#Text=Effective facilitation can help your organization maximize its resources by getting the most from the people who work with you .

#Text=While there are a number of seminars , trainings and workshops to learn how to effectively facilitate or become certified as a facilitator , if you do not have the resources to hire a facilitator or become one , here are some tips to help get you started .
#Text=Following are some tips for effective facilitation .
#Text=Establish ground rules to encourage positive group interaction .
#Text=Start with a few of your own and ask the group to for any others they would like to include .
#Text=What is said in this room , stays in this room
#Text=Use “ I ” instead of “ you ” or “ we ”
#Text=There are no right or wrong answers .
#Text=Our responses are based on our unique experience
#Text=Keep the focus of the conversation on the situation or issue .
#Text=Maintain the confidence and esteem of all participants .
#Text=As a facilitator , your talk time should be less than 40 %
#Text=Be comfortable with silence – it may be a time of thought .
#Text=Wait a full 10 seconds after asking a question .
#Text=Use your personal experience as an example when appropriate .
#Text=Speak clearly , at a moderate pace and an appropriate volume .
#Text=Transition smoothly from one activity or discussion to another .
#Text=Use visual aids to enhance and reinforce .
#Text=Ask for questions in an open manner – “ What questions do you have ? ”
#Text=If you are confident and have a good time , others will too !
#Text=Know what you want to achieve and be able to clearly articulate the desired outcome .
#Text=Practice what you want to say , how you will say it .
#Text=Allow the other person to “ save face ” .
#Text=Acknowledge the value of the person ’s concerns .
#Text=Acknowledge that you hear and understand by paraphrasing .
#Text=To get the group back on topic , ask participants to link the conversation to the issue you are discussing .
